data.title: Great for small children
data.text: I took my eighteen month old grandson who thoroughly loved this place. He was able to play with a variety of toys, interact with other children, and run around in an air conditioned building. He was especially fascinated by the Chino Police motorcycle. There were other grandparents there as well who agreed it was a great place to come with children. We will be going again this year and over the coming years as well.

data.title: Fun Place for Kids
data.text: Youth Museum is for children, but very fun for adults too.  Informative things to see and do for the kids. Very clean.

data.title: Perfect for the littles!
data.text: Chino Youth Museum is a perfect place to take the little ones for a few hours. It is set up like a town with lots for the kids to explore. They also do birthday parties there. It's on the smaller side, so it usually keeps my kids busy for just a couple of hours. An extra special treat is to walk down the street to Royalty Cakes and get a cupcake afterward!

data.title: Fun place for children in a safe environment
data.text: The museum has seasonal, summer and monthly events which include arts and crafts, games and projects. The museum is a great place to play and learn. I have taken all 4 my grandchildren and they absolutely love it.

data.title: Fun place for young children at a great price
data.text: Chino Youth Museum is a great place to spend some time with your young child. Although somewhat limited in scope due to the building size, it is still a site with many physical and role playing actives for young children. The many themed areas focusing on the life and times around Chino are quite engaging, entertaining and educational for children. Budget priced at $2 for children and $3 for accompanying adult the museum is worth the time you spend. Scheduled periodic events and activities for varying ages and skills hosted by the museum will required a modest additional fee. The only negative issue is the sometimes presence of much older school-age children that tend to monopolize activities and are too physical for the pre-school and toddler set that are the main attendees. But still a wonderful place for an activity an educational experience for young children.

data.title: 1st time visit
data.text: My 5 yr old had a nice time here. It's a small place but fun for the little kids to pretend their are a fire person or police officer.

data.title: Great Little Museum for Younger Children
data.text: I have been taking my grandchildren to this museum for many years.  They love the small town with a bank, fire department, shopping area, and all matter of buildings to explore.  Small enough that kiddos can't get lost, have a blast and can run free.  They always ask to go when they come and stay with us.. Love this museum and recommend for young families with small children and great for grandparents too!

data.title: First Friday
data.text: Free admission on the first Friday of every month. I would recommend this museum for small children. I've brought my kids here when they were younger and they always enjoyed it. Lots of pretend play and hands-on areas. You could keep a kid busy here for about 2 hours. It's worth checking out if you have a young child.

data.title: Small local youth museum
data.text:
We took our two year old grand daughter here, the cost is low. They have about eight different areas for kids to explore, a dress-up area, a retired police motorcycle to sit on, a fireman's suit hanging from the ceiling, a kid sized kitchen, local vegetable display, local newspaper display, where the water goes, ect. 
All areas are interactive and kids up to 6 years old would enjoy, a good place for kids to explore things.

data.title: Great place for kids!
data.text: Have taken my granddaughter here a lot over the years. She loved the stage where you can dress up and entertain. Lots do do with the exhibits changing over the years. Bank, TV station, play house, jail, fireman's pole. It's very cozy and good for young children.  Children get in free with a small donation (fee) charged for adults. They host birthday parties  in a party room for about $200 which include crafts and admission  This placed gets a lot of use and only wish they had a bigger budget to replace things when they get worn or used up.  It would be a great idea if patrons would donate dress up costumes to the Theater area  or other items (like play food or dishes) that could be used in the play house.  Even better make a CASH donation!

data.title: Imaginations run wild!
data.text: My daughter loves this place. She can dress up and just be a kid.  It small so you can handle multiple kids there, but big enough to have fun. We love this place.

data.title: Great little museum
data.text:
We've been here a few times, so not sure why it's taken me this long to write a review.  My son started going here when he was 2 and now he's 6 and still loves it.  It's like a little pretend city with a bank, a news station, a theater section where kids can dress up, and a little play house.  They have a pretend jail and fireman's pole too.  It's a great place for the kids to get out their energy in a safe environment.

I've even had his birthday party here.  They have a party room that I rented for the entire Saturday for only $200 and that includes admission for everyone into the museum and 25 crafts that you can pass out to the kids.  The employees are very attentive and are willing to help in any way.  Only downside is no warmers of any kind.  But they provide the tables and the chairs.  I think it's a great location for a birthday party.  My son's birthday is in the middle of summer and it's so hot.  It's a great way to stay cool.

data.title: Small, fun, manageable with very young kids
data.text: Very small museum in the heart of old Chino.  Cute area.
